[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 194]
Reasoning: **Evaluating game strategy**

If we defeat the boss, we win the game, so money might not be a priority. However, if there's something in the shop that can help us beat the boss, we might want to buy it first. Skipping big purchases could mean less power against the boss. The interesting part is that all cards are debuffed until we sell a joker, and it seems we might need to do this in the shop, not during the boss round.
**Analyzing boss strategy**

The boss states we must sell a joker to nullify its effect. I realize that even during a blind select, the command to sell a joker is available. So, it seems strategically smart to sell a weak joker before facing the boss to avoid debuffs. We can earn $4 in the current blind round, but with consumables full and no funds, I wonder about the investment tag. Even if the game allows continued play after beating 8 bosses, our goal remains to win before that point, so I’m not sure the investment is necessary.
**Planning round strategy**

I think it’s smarter to play big blind to earn money before facing the boss, allowing me to shop for a better joker or planet. I need to remember that using Popcorn decreases the multiplier by -4 per round played, which affects my strategy. After the ante 8 round, my multiplier might drop to +8 from a starting +12. Luckily, I have strong chips like two pair at level 6 with a scaling multiplier. Each played card contributes to scoring, even the kickers, which is an exciting feature!
**Clarifying scoring mechanics**

I’m considering whether all played cards factor into the scoring hand, even though the best 5 cards determine the base hand. It seems likely this could amplify face chips and multipliers, allowing for significant scoring. I need to accumulate 75k in big blind, which might take 2-3 hands, but my last two pair hand got me 37k. For the boss, I’ll need 100k. However, if my cards are debuffed, they won't add their chip values or enhancements, but I think jokers could still trigger due to face cards played.
**Considering strategy before boss battle**

I'm trying to figure out how debuffed cards will behave. They seem to lose their chip value and abilities, but face cards may still count toward scoring, even when debuffed. Since we need to sell a joker to lift the debuff, I think it makes sense to sell the weakest joker before facing the boss. I could also play big blind first to earn money and possibly buy other items for the boss fight, avoiding skipping the hand to keep Popcorn's value higher. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
